item.title: Nanou add a quote by Brian Thompson
item.description: "The real purpose of friendship was to discover and exploit weakness in others." -- Brian Thompson

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Brian Thompson
item.description: "Doing nothing when nothing is happening is no relaxation." -- Brian Thompson

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "Books say: She did this because. Life says: She did this. Books are where things are explained to you; life is where things aren't. I'm not surprised some people prefer books. Books make sense of life. The only problem is that the lives they make sense of are other people's lives, never your own." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "To be stupid, and selfish, and to have good health are the three requirements for happiness - though if stupidity is lacking, the others are useless." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "WHORES. Necessary in the nineteenth century for the contraction of syphilis, without which no one could claim genius." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Brian Thompson
item.description: "I feel a horror for exaggerated love or friendship. It's just too well demonstrated to me that when the moment comes that one asks something, or has need of something, the responce is not worth a biscuit." -- Brian Thompson

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Karen Joy Fowler
item.description: "Allegra's Austen wrote about the impact of financial need on the intimate lives of women. If she'd worked in a bookstore, Allegra would have shelved Austen in the horror section." -- Karen Joy Fowler

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Stephen Fry
item.description: "Literary studies were no more than a series of autopsies performed by heartless technicians. Worse than autopsies: biopsies. Vivisection. Even movies, which I love more than anything, more than life itself, they even do it with movies these days." -- Stephen Fry

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "For what do we live, but to make sport for our neighbors, and laugh at them in our turn?" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Indeed, I am very sorry to be right in this instance. I would much rather have been merry than wise." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "And that was all the part of it - the way you were obliged to live. You stifled a groan, you lied about your love, you deceived your legal wife, and all in the name of honour. That was the damned paradox of it - in order to behave well, you have to behave badly." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Robert Benchley
item.description: "There are two kinds of travel: first class and with children." -- Robert Benchley

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Diane Setterfield
item.description: "I've nothing against people who love truth. Apart from the fact that they make dull companions." -- Diane Setterfield

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "The only thing worse than a boy who hates you: a boy that loves you." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Like most misery, it started with apparent happiness." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "No one who had ever seen Catherine Morland in her infancy, would have supposed her born to be a heroine... But from fifteen to seventeen she was in training for a heroine..." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Clare Boylan
item.description: "Talking about ideas for a novel is a bit like showing pictures of the ultrasound if you're pregnant. Until they're out in the world, they can only be wonderful to you." -- Clare Boylan

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "The trouble is not that I am single and likely to stay single, but that I am lonely and likely to stay lonely." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Stephen Fry
item.description: "My first words, as I was being born [...] I looked up at my mother and said, 'that's the last time I'm going up one of those." -- Stephen Fry

item.title: Nanou add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "To hurt is as human as to breathe." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Stephen Fry
item.description: "I have written it before and am not ashamed to write it again. Without Wodehouse I am not sure that I would be a tenth of what I am today -- whatever that may be. In my teenage years, his writings awoke me to the possibilities of language. His rhythms, tropes, tricks and mannerisms are deep within me. But more than that, he taught me something about good nature. It is enough to be benign, to be gentle, to be funny, to be kind." -- Stephen Fry

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "It is a curious thought, but it is only when you see people looking ridiculous that you realize just how much you love them. " -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "Women can accept the fact that a man is a rotter, a swindler, a drug taker, a confirmed liar, and a general swine, without batting an eyelash, and without its impairing their affection for the brute in the least. Women are wonderful realists. " -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Nanou add a quote by A.S. Byatt
item.description: "No mere human can stand in a fire and not be consumed." -- A.S. Byatt

item.title: Nanou add a quote by A.S. Byatt
Nanou add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "It is a melancholy truth that even great men have their poor relations." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Nanou add a quote by Dorothy L. Sayers
item.description: "Time and trouble will tame an advanced young woman, but an advanced old woman is uncontrollable by any earthly force." -- Dorothy L. Sayers

item.title: Nanou add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "A detective story generally describes six living men discussing how it is that a man is dead. A modern philosophic story generally describes six dead men discussing how any man can possibly be alive." -- G.K. Chesterton
